subject: Science
title: Oxygen: The Life Giver
description: A micro-lesson that makes Oxygen: The Life Giver usable.

hook.text: Oxygen makes up 21% of the air. Too little and you die. Too much and you catch fire.

buildup.text: Your cells use oxygen to burn glucose, releasing energy to power every function.

discovery.text: Without oxygen, brain cells start dying in about four minutes.

twist.text: Pure oxygen is actually toxic. At high concentrations, it damages lungs and eyes.

climax.text: Oxygen is also the most abundant element in Earth's crust â€” bound in rocks and water.

punchline.text: Oxygen keeps you alive at 21%. At 100%, it kills you. Dosage matters.

quiz.question: What percentage of Earth's atmosphere is oxygen?
